intro: Scholtzia trilocularis, commonly known as the three-chambered scholtzia, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a peppery scent when crushed. Scholtzia trilocularis is typically found in rocky habitats and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
